document_data.name: Strohm V
document_data.mainbody: King '''Strohm V''' was a king of [[Tethyr]] and a famous [[druid]], who became an oak tree when he died.
document_data.Relationships: Strohm V was the second nephew and only heir of the previous king, [[Strohm IV]]. He had no sons but at least two daughters, the second who would become Queen [[Alisande Bormul|Alisande]].
document_data.History:
Strohm V was born in the [[787 DR|Year of the Rotting Orchard, 787 DR]]. He took the throne in the [[802 DR|Year of the Patchworked Peace]].

Legends say that when King Strohm V died, he changed into an oak tree. Since he had no sons, the [[Strohm Dynasty]] was ended. [[Tibor Mallorhen]], the husband of Strohm's oldest daughter became the first ruler of the short-lived [[Mallorhen Dynasty]]. Following the death of the second Mallorhen king, Tethyr would be ruled by four of Strohm V's female descendants, a period of time known as the [[Queens' Dynasty|Queens' Era]].
